Delicious is a social bookmarking website – the primary use of Delicious is to store your bookmarks online
column2: which allows you to access the same bookmarks from any computer and add bookmarks from anywhere
column4: you can use tags to organize and remember your bookmarks
column5: which is a much more flexible system than folders.

column1: You can also use del.icio.us to see the interesting links that your friends and other people bookmark
column2: and share links with them in return. You can even browse and search Delicious to discover the cool and useful bookmarks that everyone else has saved – which is made easy with tags.

column1: Delicious was acquired by Yahoo on December 9
column2: 2005. No formal acquisition price was disclosed
column3: though it has been speculated at $10 to $15 million. Early seed round investors include Marc Andreessen

column1: In September 2007 Delicious showed an upcoming version 2 to the public
column2: along with the announcement of a complete re-write of the code base.
Delicious was acquired by Chad Hurley and Steve Chen’s AVOS Systems. Since the acquisition
column3:
Delicious has undergone several redesigns.
